Douglas Rushkoff - Born Tripping

21 May 2011

When you're born tripping, you don't know you're tripping. The possibility of a more considered engagement with media is worth pursuing.

Doug Rushkoff came to speak to us about his book Program or be Programmed. I don't agree entirely that absolutely everybody needs to know how to program in order to engage with new media, but I take his point - that a basic understanding of the tools and processes used in the construction of media is very useful.

Rushkoff's talk made me want to read Amusing Ourselves to Death again - no bad thing.

Paul May is a researcher and designer from Dublin, living and working in London. See more of Paul's work or get in touch.
